text: - My name is Rishabh Animesh.
I'm a senior software development manager
on the S3 Glacier team.

I've been with AWS for
close to nine years now,
and with the S3 Glacier group since 2013.
(upbeat music)

I started with the S3 Glacier
as a software engineer,
you know, as an STE1,

grew into being a senior
engineer in this space.
I really liked the technology

and the way this sort of
organization was headed

and decided to take on a
management role in 2018
and since then I've been managing teams.
And I really like working with people,
really like the technology

and that's what kept me
attracted with the group.
As part of being a manager on Amazon,

people management is one aspect,
but what really attracts me

is the ability of also
contributing technically.
You can be part of the design discussions.
Every now and then,

you get to sort of attend
the operational reviews
and even participate in operational events
such as customer interaction.

So I do enjoy that part
of the job as well,

which helps me sort of stay
connected to the technical side
while also doing people management.
(upbeat music)
If you're considering a career with AWS,

one of the first things that
pops into my mind is scale.
You know, I think we've come a long way
and the number of customers

and the number of verticals
we impact worldwide
is just a immense.

So from day one, you get
to interact with customers

from across the globe and at a
scale which is unprecedented.

And I think what's exciting is
that we are sort of evolving
and growing every day so the challenges
that the level of scale AWS has
poses, day by day, increases over time.

And that translates to exciting
engineering opportunities.
The other aspect that comes to mind

if you're considering a job
in AWS or a career with AWS,

is the people, really
smart, empathetic leaders
who are technically very motivated,
want to solve customer problem

and are here to sort of
help you grow and succeed.
(dramatic music)
